intro: Acianthopsis bracteata, commonly known as the bracted acianthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Bromeliaceae, which includes many epiphytic and terrestrial species. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are often covered in a dense, water-repelling trichome layer. Its inflorescence consists of a single, showy flower that emerges from the center of the rosette. Acianthopsis bracteata is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
